intro: Hazardia berberidis, commonly known as desert parsley, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is well adapted to harsh desert conditions, with deep roots that help it survive in low-water environments. Hazardia berberidis is also known for its aromatic foliage, which contains compounds that can be used in traditional herbal remedies.
